definition[0]: (1926) a famous book for children by A.A. Milne, about a boy called Christopher Robin and his teddy bear Winnie-the-Pooh, who is also called Pooh or Pooh Bear. Pooh is not very clever or brave, but he is very cheerful and helpful and has lots of friends, including Eeyore, Piglet, and Tigger. He likes inventing songs and poems and his favourite food is honey.
